title: General
description: Establishes the foundational requirements for harvest crew operations including on-site food safety responsibility and written hygiene and health rules covering worker and visitor hygiene, health protocols, and contamination prevention

requirements.text: Is there a trained on-site person(s) responsible for the operation's food safety program?
mandatoryStatements: Trained person(s) is designated as responsible for food safety program
Person is on-site during harvest operations
Training records demonstrate food safety competency
Authority to stop operations if food safety is compromised
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of training records and competency, quarterly observation of food safety oversight activities
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily verification that trained person is on-site during harvest operations, weekly review of food safety decisions and actions

requirements.text: Does the operation have a written food safety hygiene and health rules covering at least worker and visitor hygiene and health, infants and toddlers, animal presence in growing and storage areas, fecal matter, dropped product, blood and bodily fluids?
mandatoryStatements: Written food safety hygiene and health rules are documented
Rules cover worker hygiene and health requirements
Rules cover visitor hygiene and health requirements
Policy addresses infants and toddlers in operational areas
Rules prohibit or control animal presence in growing and storage areas
Procedures address fecal matter contamination response
Rules cover dropped product handling and disposition
Procedures address blood and bodily fluids contamination response
Rules are communicated to all workers and visitors
Rules are available in languages understood by workers
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of written hygiene and health rules for completeness and current applicability, quarterly verification of rule communication
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily observation of hygiene and health rule compliance, immediate response to violations or contamination events

capaInject: If no trained person on-site: halt harvest operations, designate and train qualified person within 24 hours before restart
If written hygiene and health rules missing or incomplete: develop comprehensive rules within 7 days, train all personnel before next harvest
If hygiene rule violations observed: immediate retraining, document corrective action, escalate for repeated violations
If contamination events occur: immediate product containment, investigate root cause within 24 hours, implement preventive measures before restart
traceabilityInject: Training records for on-site food safety responsible person must be traceable to dates, topics, and trainers
Hygiene and health rule communications must be traceable to specific training dates and attendees
Contamination event records must be traceable to date, location, product affected, and corrective actions taken
